segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Three days of travel have elapsed as your band has made your way east through the Dvalmar Pass, through the ancestral dwarven lands of Kavros. Tall mountains peaked in snow, the wind whips through the mountains, especially as you begin your descent from the summit of the pass high in the middle of your journey.
segments.summary: Opening narration describing three days of travel through the Dvalmar Pass

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: It's three days across the pass, and descending now, the cold winds of Helvar that have whipped up across the vastness of the Endless Night. The cold, frigid air of a land that does not know the touch of the sun. Of course, the Stormwrack to your south (thunder crashing), hearing endlessly the fall of eternal rain on mountains that have known a ceaseless storm for 70 years.
segments.summary: Description of the harsh weather conditions from Helvar and the Stormwrack

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Towards the eastern edge of the pass, what state do we find our adventurers in making their way under heavy cloaks, some of you disguising your noble lineage, unsure what dangers possibly await you here on the road?
segments.summary: DM asking about the party's current state as they travel in disguise

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos
segments.content: I'd say Julien likely looks, I mean, not quite as rough as you probably in a realistic sense, but-- I'd say, at the very least he's not gotten much sleep in recent days trying to remain as vigilant as possible for a number of folks within this grouping and is showing a bit of wear on his face. As the cold wind hits, he bundles up heavily. He's kept himself quite heavily obscured from any recognition. His markings of his house all removed and kept away from any passing eyes. He's also been, I'll say, along the ride probably helping keeping vigilant eye on the road ahead and helping scout where need be, though likely probably challenged at times by other capable people.
segments.summary: Matt describes Julien's appearance and behavior - sleep-deprived from vigilance, disguised, scouting ahead

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: Too soon.
segments.summary: OOC comment from Aabria

segments.speaker: Vaelus
segments.content: No. With us? Yeah. (laughter)
segments.summary: OOC banter about scouting capabilities

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: At this point, I think we just let him do it a little bit because he's got to have something.
segments.summary: OOC comment about letting Julien scout

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: How's Thaisha looking?
segments.summary: DM asking about Thaisha's state

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: I think the first two days were Thaisha's mourning period. Every time she leaves Dol-Makjar she has to put down the version of herself that was with Hal and her kids and the world and family and life that she knew. But right around day three, especially with the storm and the cold and how uncomfortable she is now, this is the opposite of home and Thaisha is becoming herself again. So she's actually a little more chipper. She's whistling bird song for local fauna that's here and occasionally wants to go and help scout ahead. But you're doing a very good job, so she's going to let you continue to do that, and mostly will stay tight to Aranessa and will help keep an eye on her because she knows the other travel companions are a little more self-sufficient out here on the road.
segments.summary: Aabria describes Thaisha's emotional journey from mourning to becoming herself again, now more chipper and protective of Aranessa

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: How's Vaelus looking?
segments.summary: DM asking about Vaelus's state

segments.speaker: Vaelus
segments.content: Vaelus takes up the back of the group and is constantly scanning, never stopping. Very much used to traveling these parts and going on long journeys like this alone. So having companions here is weird, and new, and different. But the few days that I've spent with these people and seeing what they've been going through, she's trying very hard to maintain distance and not get close.
segments.summary: Ashley describes Vaelus as vigilant rear guard, experienced with solo travel, trying to maintain emotional distance from the group

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Aranessa bears the name of a house that rose up against the god of the sun. I think that she keeps a polite distance as well. I think maybe she's offered you to pour your goblet one of these nights at a roadside inn, and that's about the extent of the warmth that she has shown.
segments.summary: Brennan describes Aranessa's polite but distant behavior toward Vaelus

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Occtis?
segments.summary: DM asking about Occtis's state

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis
segments.content: I think everything around Occtis is in soft focus right now, these last couple days as he's internalizing and trying to understand what happened to him in the best way he can, which is intellectualizing it. So unless someone directly speaks to him or he has to do something, he's constantly dealing with what's new. The fact that he knows it's cold, but he doesn't feel cold like a person feels cold anymore. He's not worried that he's going to die from exposure because he's not going to. Just all these little things that keep popping into his head as he goes where he-- His hands are cold, he doesn't see his breath in the storm, and things like that.
segments.summary: Alexander describes Occtis as mentally processing his transformation, noticing differences in how he experiences cold and physical sensations

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Looking down, the Dvalmar Pass is a ancient dwarven-made highway. It runs over the top of the mountains and is of a strange type in that it is a gift. The dwarves' roads ran deep beneath the mountains. They needed this path for nothing at all, but in ancient times created this road such that there would be a way for the Obridimian Empire to come and aid them at the western edge of their border. It was made for the human might of the old Obridimian Empire to come west.
segments.summary: Historical description of the Dvalmar Pass as a dwarven gift to allow the Obridimian Empire to aid them

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thus, you know, this ancient part of it is much grander and filled with these ancient dwarven statues. The last 30 or 40 miles of it are newer because it terminated far in advance of the ancient walls of Dol-Makjar where countless mountain battle sites watched dwarven and human allies crash against the orcish shield wall of Dol-Makjar for countless ages of war that occurred over and over and over again.
segments.summary: Description of the pass's construction and its role in ancient wars between human-dwarf allies and orcs at Dol-Makjar

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So interesting to take that first day's travel through the new pass built by the Revolutionary Council when the peoples of Aramán were united against the gods. Here, you find the old pass for a different purpose in a different chapter in history. As the mountain pass winds down, you see dwarven statues, these ones less grandiose than the ones at the Guardian Wall in Dol-Makjar. These ones are a little bit more stout and made of blocks placed together, but of dwarven soldiers that mark the way to the west. You see at the base of the statues is the Dwarven word for 'courage' over and over again.
segments.summary: Description of newer Revolutionary Council construction contrasted with older dwarven statues marked with the word for 'courage'

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Looking down, snow gripping the road here, you see that, like the pass has many places, small inns, general stores. You can't really go more than an hour's journey, even through parts of the wilderness, you'll travel for an hour or two and another shop will be there or something else because all of the wealth of Kahad and the Sundered Houses funnels like an artery through this pass.
segments.summary: Description of the commercial infrastructure along the pass due to trade wealth flowing through it

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Looking down here you see that there appears to be a snowfall or some collapse in the mountains that has momentarily blocked the road. You can see that there is a few dwarven guards that point up to an attendant pass off the mountainside directing people around the landfall. Some people are moving through. It seems that there's still enough space for the main pass to be useful, but you do see some banners down there. Anyone who wants to can give me a perception check.
segments.summary: Description of a mountain collapse blocking the main road with guards directing traffic around it, and visible banners below

segments.speaker: Multiple
segments.content: Yeah. I'll take it as I'm scouting. Mm-hmm. Yeah. I'm back. Okay, we're okay, we're okay. 17. 16.
segments.summary: Multiple players rolling perception checks

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: 16. On a 16-- (laughs) You guys got it. On a 16, Thaisha, you look down and see some banners of what looks to be the Revolutionary Council down there. Occtis, you see one banner of your house flying down there.
segments.summary: Results of perception checks - Thaisha sees Revolutionary Council banners, Occtis sees his house banner

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis
segments.content: (inhales) We don't go down there.
segments.summary: Occtis immediately suggests avoiding the area with his house banner

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: Hm?
segments.summary: Thaisha questioning Occtis's statement

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis
segments.content: We shouldn't go down there.
segments.summary: Occtis reiterating they should avoid the area

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: Why?
segments.summary: Thaisha asking for explanation

segments.speaker: Vaelus
segments.content: Down where?
segments.summary: Vaelus asking for clarification

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis
segments.content: Family.
segments.summary: Occtis explaining the reason is family

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: Oh.
segments.summary: Thaisha understanding

segments.speaker: Vaelus
segments.content: Why on earth would that be a problem? I'm just kidding.
segments.summary: Vaelus making a sarcastic joke about family problems

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (laughs)
segments.summary: DM laughing at the joke

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: Is that the first joke I've ever heard-- Okay.
segments.summary: Thaisha commenting on Vaelus making a joke

segments.speaker: Vaelus
segments.content: I make jokes all the time. We don't know each other that well yet.
segments.summary: Vaelus defending her sense of humor

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: All right, you've been in the back.
segments.summary: Thaisha acknowledging Vaelus has been at the back of the group

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos
segments.content: Do you recognize any family present?
segments.summary: Julien asking Occtis if he can see specific family members

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis
segments.content: Not that I can see, but I do see the banner.
segments.summary: Occtis confirming he can't see specific family but sees the house banner

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: Down, boy. Mm-mm, too soon.
segments.summary: OOC comment from Aabria

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis
segments.content: I know what you want. If they were there, I'd tell you.
segments.summary: Occtis addressing someone (likely Julien) about what information he'd provide

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos
segments.content: I hope you would. Just be vigilant. I will as well. (horse trots ahead)
segments.summary: Julien expressing trust but maintaining vigilance, then moving ahead

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Do any of you read Dwarven, speak or read Dwarven?
segments.summary: DM asking about Dwarven language skills

segments.speaker: Multiple
segments.content: Do I? No. No. (laughs) Help? I know.
segments.summary: Players checking if their characters speak Dwarven

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see some words in Dwarven as you pass by, and you see, riding around, there's a small village, Adzar, a dwarven village that has a pass that joins the Dvalmar here, and then a longer mountain pass that goes around that is not-- moving a little bit faster, essentially. It's a little detour to get around the collapse away from where this Tachonis banner is flying. It will only add probably two hours to your trip, but it'll get you away from where you need to go.
segments.summary: Description of the village Adzar and an alternate route that would avoid the Tachonis banner area

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: ddess of the forge, were shattered. You can see that there has now been writing and these lanterns have been left here as a mark of contrition, atonement, sorrow. On a nat 20 perception, in the shattered bases of the statues, there's something hidden. You look and see behind this wall that where these statues, and it looks like these statues are centuries old and were shattered about a little, you know, 65 years ago, something like that. You see behind them there is something in the base of this wall. On a 20, you see a bit of writing in Druidic, in a Dwarven dialect of Druidic, and recognize that this wall was a holy site of Tehana, and recognize that this wall was a holy site of Tehana, who was the primordial of earth, and that these statues were built to deface it.
segments.summary: Brennan reveals the hidden writing in Druidic about Tehana, the primordial of earth, and that the statues were built to deface this holy site

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah. Huh. I don't think Thaisha even acknowledges this woman anymore. She is going to storm back to the horse.
segments.summary: Thaisha is upset and ignores the old woman, storming back to her horse

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I don't want to talk.
segments.summary: Thaisha refuses to engage in conversation

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Okay. All right, that's fine.
segments.summary: Occtis accepts Thaisha's desire not to talk

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I didn't-- I can hear you breathe. I used to hear you breathe.
segments.summary: Thaisha mentions how she used to hear Occtis breathe when he was alive

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Y-yeah, doesn't really happen anymore. Well, I mean, when I talk, I do have to breathe air across the vocal cords, which cause the sound of-- Never mind.
segments.summary: Occtis explains how his undead state affects his breathing, then stops himself

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It's okay. (sighs)
segments.summary: Thaisha accepts Occtis's explanation

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: What's wrong?
segments.summary: Occtis asks Thaisha what's bothering her

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I explain what I saw.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains her discovery about the defaced holy site

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Oh, I'm sorry.
segments.summary: Occtis expresses sympathy for what Thaisha discovered

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It's not your fault.
segments.summary: Thaisha says the situation isn't Occtis's fault

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I know.
segments.summary: Occtis acknowledges he knows it's not his fault

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It's not even her fault. She's just so desperate to go back to what they remember, even if it was worse.
segments.summary: Thaisha reflects on the old woman's desperation to return to the past

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yeah.
segments.summary: Occtis agrees with Thaisha's assessment

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: My eyes flick over in the direction that I last remember Vaelus being.
segments.summary: Thaisha looks toward where Vaelus was

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I'm just staring this whole time. Have been watching this whole exchange with Thaisha, never taking my eyes off of her.
segments.summary: Vaelus has been intently watching Thaisha throughout the conversation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me a perception check. You can do so with advantage.
segments.summary: Brennan calls for a perception check with advantage

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: That's pretty good.
segments.summary: Vaelus indicates she rolled well

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Let's go.
segments.summary: Thaisha encourages the good roll

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: All right. 24.
segments.summary: Vaelus reveals her high perception roll

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You look at Thaisha. You're not taking your eyes off her at all. You realize that a village that cannot force-- You realize that a village that cannot help but be forced to see the Stormwrack would attract a certain kind of person. These are people that do not want to let go. You can recognize that.
segments.summary: Brennan explains Vaelus's insight about the village attracting people who don't want to let go of the past

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I'm going to hop off my horse.
segments.summary: Vaelus dismounts her horse

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I would like to walk through some of the shattered statues and peek over to where Thaisha was looking.
segments.summary: Vaelus investigates the area where Thaisha was looking

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Can you speak Druidic?
segments.summary: Brennan asks if Vaelus can read Druidic

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: No.
segments.summary: Vaelus cannot speak Druidic

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Can you speak Sylvan?
segments.summary: Brennan asks if Vaelus can speak Sylvan

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: No.
segments.summary: Vaelus cannot speak Sylvan either

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see a script that you cannot recognize. You remember the shape of the letters. It is in a different script than the Dwarven written here over and over again. But you point your attention to it. Some kind of writing. Probably it was part of the tradition of Trozhna. I mean, that would make sense, wouldn't it?
segments.summary: Brennan describes the unreadable script Vaelus sees, possibly related to Trozhna

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: (horse hooves clomping) What you're looking at, elf?
segments.summary: Sir Julien approaches on horseback and asks what Vaelus is examining

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I don't know. There's something here but I, I can't read it.
segments.summary: Vaelus explains she found writing but cannot read it

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Hmm. I read Sylvan.
segments.summary: Sir Julien offers to help, mentioning he can read Sylvan

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Reading Sylvan, you see it's written in a different language than Sylvan, but it's close enough that you can get some kind of, the words around it are words, but there's a name here, and I think you recognize the name Tehana. Tehana in some ancient, you know, you had a noble's education. Tehana was the wife of Trozhna, the titan of earth. I think you look at it and just see it only was revealed from the destroyed statue here.
segments.summary: Sir Julien can partially read the text and recognizes Tehana's name, wife of Trozhna the titan of earth

segments.speaker: Aranessa (Brennan)
segments.content: Aranessa calls out, "I think we'd best go." She looks out and sees the old woman dwarf speaking to what looks like a granddaughter. Says, "Best not to tarry."
segments.summary: Aranessa suggests they should leave, observing the dwarf woman with her granddaughter

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks at you, Thaisha, Aranessa, and goes, "If people have chosen to live in this moment, then we do them a courtesy and a respect by letting them live in it," and she gets her horse moving along. You continue down, bypassing the Tachonis banner, making your way to Helvar, old Obridimia, the birthplace of the Sundered Houses.
segments.summary: The group respects the villagers' choice to live in the past and continues toward Helvar in old Obridimia

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And we will see you next time as we begin the journey of the Seekers' Table on the next episode of Critical Role.
segments.summary: Brennan ends the Seekers' Table portion, transitioning to the next group

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Hello, and welcome to the Critical Role Announcement Playhouse.
segments.summary: Matt begins the announcement segment

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: And our sponsor for tonight is Boot.dev. Sam? Sam, are you okay?
segments.summary: Matt introduces the Boot.dev sponsor and checks on Sam

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Sure am, Matt. Hey, are you interested in coding? Want to become a software developer? Boot.dev will take you from beginner to expert the fun way through a hands-on RPG-like experience. You'll follow a real dev curriculum, but it'll feel like a game, in the most captivating, addictive coding education. In fact, Boot.dev gave me a free trial, and I was so curious about backend web development that I went ahead and became an expert in Python.
segments.summary: Sam delivers the Boot.dev advertisement about learning coding

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: You did?
segments.summary: Matt questions Sam's claim about learning Python

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Yep. And what a wild ride it was.
segments.summary: Sam confirms he learned Python and sets up a montage

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Was that a learning montage?
segments.summary: Matt asks about the montage that just played

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Oh, we're back. (laughs) It was, Matt. But what if I told you it was the wrong one? I said I learned Python, but that montage was me learning nylon, which is not the same thing.
segments.summary: Sam reveals the first montage was wrong, showing him learning nylon instead of Python

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Okay. You want to want to wrap it up?
segments.summary: Matt tries to conclude the ad segment

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Nope. Matt, I'm so proud of using Boot.dev, I want to show off my skills. In fact, I remember learning it like it was yesterday.
segments.summary: Sam insists on showing more montages of his learning experience

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Again, that was the wrong montage.
segments.summary: Sam admits the second montage was also wrong

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Gotcha. Okay, but now I kind of understand the band-aids.
segments.summary: Matt comments on understanding Sam's band-aids from the montage

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Yes. I really did earn XP levels, achievements, and completed quests while learning to code. In fact, I remember it like it was yesterday.
segments.summary: Sam explains the gamification aspects of Boot.dev and sets up another montage

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: And there, that was the correct montáge.
segments.summary: Sam confirms the third montage was the correct one, mispronouncing 'montage'

segments.speaker: Cast
segments.content: Montáge!
segments.summary: Multiple cast members mock Sam's pronunciation

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Did I say that weird?
segments.summary: Sam questions his pronunciation

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: You did, yeah.
segments.summary: Marisha confirms Sam's weird pronunciation

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Montáge.
segments.summary: Ashley repeats the mispronunciation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: of the Sundered Houses here in the city of Dol-Makjar. What followed was his Farramh, an orcish funerary custom, where treasures and prayers were gathered around his body. You discovered that the plan to spring him at the last minute had been ruined by a betrayal from even within one of his criminal contacts and a former brother of the Torn Banner. The Soldiers' table headed north after the treacherous Casimir Gavendale and looking for Cyd Pridesire, Teor's brother. In the past 48 hours, also, not only did the young Lord Wicander Halovar discover that there is a monstrosity of a celestial chained up in his basement and then flee the city, House Tachonis slaughtered all of the inhabitants of the Palazzo Davinos, declaring that the houses of Royce and Davinos would fall. Occtis Tachonis was slaughtered on a table, his heart ripped out of his body and replaced with an elven artifact known as the Stone of Nightsong. That stone was removed by him in the afterlife and by Murray Mag'Nesson and Bolaire Lathalia here in Dol-Makjar in the grounds of the Lloy estate at four o'clock in the morning after way too much shit had happened.
segments.summary: DM recaps recent events including Occtis's death and resurrection with the Stone of Nightsong

segments.speaker: Marisha Ray
segments.content: That sounds insane.

segments.speaker: Taliesin Jaffe
segments.content: How I roll.

segments.speaker: Luis Carazo
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Marisha Ray
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Witnessing-- Since the death of the gods there has been no resurrection. And that remains true. Young Occtis Tachonis was not brought back from the dead, but he walks Aramán as something, seemingly under his own control. You are left with several questions hanging overhead. What did your brother get you all into? Why did he tell you that Bolaire had paint or to look after Murray at the Penteveral? Why did he send your former life partner and a still close loved one, Thaisha Lloy, off to retrieve a cobbled-together coffin of a deceased halfling celestial from Venatus in the east? How long has a sentient mask been interested in your theater company? All of you look at a city, strange goings-on of whatever Thjazi Fang was up to that rests increasingly under the thumb of the Sundered Houses. A new dean presides at the Penteveral. The Cormorays are asking about changing wings at The Archanade, moving the Lloy Wing from its primacy here at the Revolutionary Museum. House Einfasen has relieved more than 60% of all of the Revolutionary Guard within the city of their duties as some mercenary company of the Candescent Creed waits with signup papers outside. And Hal Fang has just sent his eldest daughter to go live with her half-sister as he wears a Liar's Blade on his side. Busy couple of days.
segments.summary: DM explains Occtis's undead state and poses questions about recent events, describing the Sundered Houses' increasing control over the city

segments.speaker: Marisha Ray
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Here at the table, all of you return and have much to discuss. Lachmir, the proprietor, leans his head in and says,
segments.summary: The group gathers at a table as Lachmir, the proprietor, approaches

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Oh, we'll have plenty of privacy up here. Feel free, Hal, if you need to send word to anyone, there's some pigeons over there and all their cages are labeled, so feel free, but--
segments.summary: Lachmir offers privacy and messaging pigeons to Hal

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Could you do me a favor, Lachmir? Could you bring up equal amounts of whiskey and coffee?
segments.summary: Halandil requests whiskey and coffee from Lachmir

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Ah! The night begins in earnest. Yes, absolutely. I'll bring up a fresh-brewed pot of coffee and some, I'll get the-- Are we looking for taste or are we looking for volume as concerns whiskey?
segments.summary: Lachmir asks whether they want quality or quantity whiskey

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: (sighs)
segments.summary: Halandil sighs

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: Both.
segments.summary: Murray requests both taste and volume

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Mm.
segments.summary: Bolaire agrees

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Hm.
segments.summary: Azune acknowledges

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Ooh! Well, I'll start a tab,
segments.summary: Lachmir starts a tab for the drinks

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: and he retreats downstairs.
segments.summary: Lachmir leaves to get the drinks

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Suppose I'm paying a tab now.
segments.summary: Bolaire realizes he'll be paying the tab

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: You can afford it.
segments.summary: Murray notes Bolaire can afford the tab

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: I certainly can now.
segments.summary: Bolaire confirms he can afford it now

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Oh, good.
segments.summary: Azune responds positively

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: (sighs)
segments.summary: Bolaire sighs

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: I'm exhausted.
segments.summary: Murray expresses exhaustion

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I think I'm still on adrenaline. The exhaustion is going to catch up eventually, but (sighs) here we are, running out of time, the walls closing in, and the rug being pulled out from underneath us. I made a list of things that I'd like to bring up.
segments.summary: Azune describes feeling rushed and having prepared a list of topics

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: Maybe we should just leave. Maybe we should just-- abandon this city. Abandon ship, just run for the hills?
segments.summary: Murray suggests fleeing the city

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: No.
segments.summary: Azune rejects the idea of fleeing

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Murray, you know you would never do that.
segments.summary: Azune reminds Murray she wouldn't actually flee

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: I know!
segments.summary: Murray acknowledges she wouldn't flee

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Where would you go?
segments.summary: Halandil questions where they would go

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: I'm too stubborn. (groans)
segments.summary: Murray admits she's too stubborn to leave

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Well, before the exhaustion actually does catch up to us, I'd like to at least report what I observed today.
segments.summary: Azune wants to share his observations before exhaustion sets in

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: This is the most organized I think I've ever seen you. All right. You have notes.
segments.summary: Bolaire comments on Azune being unusually organized

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: You're talking so fast.
segments.summary: Murray notes Azune is speaking quickly

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: No, you're just listening so slow. Although yes, you are speaking quickly.
segments.summary: Bolaire teases Murray while acknowledging Azune is speaking fast

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: Shut up, Bolaire.
segments.summary: Murray tells Bolaire to be quiet

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I'll try to slow down.
segments.summary: Azune agrees to speak more slowly

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: (chuckles)
segments.summary: Bolaire chuckles

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Lists are good. Proceed.
segments.summary: Halandil encourages Azune to continue with his list

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Okay. It occurs to me that I should have probably made copies of the list and handed them out, but I guess maybe for next time.
segments.summary: Azune realizes he should have made copies of his list

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Let's just get on with it.
segments.summary: Bolaire urges Azune to proceed

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: So, earlier today when I arrived at the Brethren Hall, what I witnessed was Lord Einfasen dismissing the majority of the Revolutionary Guard, all of them angry at this sudden dismissal. And as a result of that, in protest, another number of the Revolutionary Guard resigned. Waiting outside was a mercenary group under the Candescent Creed banner, waiting to recruit them. A very convenient way to poach the Revolutionary Guard that's meant to protect the city. Do we have access to money?
segments.summary: Azune reports Lord Einfasen dismissing most of the Revolutionary Guard, with Candescent Creed mercenaries waiting to recruit them

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Strangely, I believe we do.
segments.summary: Bolaire confirms they have access to money

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Can we siphon that money?
segments.summary: Azune asks if they can redirect the money

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Oh, very much so.
segments.summary: Bolaire confirms they can siphon money

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Go over the number for me again. How many of the protectors of this city have been cut loose?
segments.summary: Halandil asks for clarification on how many guards were dismissed

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: The majority of them. Absolutely more than half. Maybe three quarters.
segments.summary: Azune clarifies that more than half, possibly three quarters of guards were dismissed

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: I told you. This is exactly what I said would happen.
segments.summary: Murray notes she predicted this would happen

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I know. I have a couple of other things on my list that I need to immediately take care of, and that's one of them.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I would hire them as a pretext to having security for moving all of the objects around. But I have a funny feeling they're going to want their own people who will turn their eyes away if they take anything.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Well, maybe we can do a little bit of both there. That's actually not a bad idea.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: If we can.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Maybe Azune can recommend some people from the Candescent Creed, whatever this new mercenary group is. Maybe we can double dip there.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I'm a little hesitant to suggest it, but I might have someone inside the Einfasen machine as well.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: You do?

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Well, there's someone in the company whose sister is an attending maid--

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Hm!

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: -- in one of the houses here and she is easy to miss and hears a lot. But I don't want to put her in danger.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: (laughs) I think it's a little late for that.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: A little late for that.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: (gasps) Oh my god! We really are so alike.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I hate it.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Are you ready for this, Hal?

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: (laughs) No. No, I'm not. I also know that one woman, Biteen, who visits our salons on occasion from House Tachonis.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Oh yes.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: This woman likes to hang out with the bohemians from time to time and visits Bolaire and my little social club. And she is a terrible gossip.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Excellent.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: And a horrendous flirt. And if I--

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I like a gossip. We could spread some rumors.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: She's already told me more about her Tachonis husband than is probably decent. So.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Hm.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: That is maybe another possible inroad.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: You also have a family name that you can lean on for quite a while. It's going to get you into some doors. And with everything that's happened to your family in the last 48 hours, my god--

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Well, that's also a question because I'm known throughout the city, but I don't know what these people think now of Thjazi's brother.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I don't know.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: You won't until they talk to you.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Right.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I think Bolaire's kind of right. It's exciting for them to rub shoulders with someone who's a bit of an outlaw.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: On the lower end, they'll be wondering, the people who did work for your brother will know that you had nothing to do with it.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: He made that very clear to anybody who would listen.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I think people are going to be wondering where my sympathies lie.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Very much, and if they're not wondering--

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: That's the thing about--

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: -- it means they know.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Thing about rich people, too, is they get their rocks off by rolling in the mud with the rest of us pigs.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Troublemakers.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I literally have a mud bath in the back of my apartment. I don't, but it would be hilarious if I did.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Hal, this person that is married to a Tachonis, I think we can use that. There's already word traveling around that something has happened, potentially, to those that at least work at the Palazzo Davinos. The people that work there haven't come home. There's some word on the street a little bit about wondering where they might be. Of course, there's no way that Tachonis would let something spread about what they've done unless they have a leak in their own family with a wife that has a big mouth.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: (chuckles)

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I can't wait to meet her.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: It doesn't matter whether he said anything to her. I think that we need to start to get them to question who they can trust within their own ranks, within their own families.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Where's Lachmir with our whiskey? I peek outside the door. Lachmir!

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Young, tone-deaf human.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: At this point, I think this is a moment to plant a seed. I'm going to, as drunkenly, with as much attempts to hide flair while giving flair as I can, make my way over to you and: Hal, if you have a second, we have to come back. I know that everything's a mess, but we really need to make sure that everything opens. If you need to make changes to the script, that's fine, we can do it, but we have to-- Oh! Oh, I'm so sorry. I see you're busy. We have to talk about this, this is just too much to deal with.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Bolaire, this is a patron.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Oh, I'm so sorry. You heard nothing, please. We'll discuss this later. Everything's fine.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks at you and says, "Are you one of Mr. Fang's performers?"

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Oh, I wish I had such a talent. No, just a very big fan.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Oh," she looks down at the mask in her hand and looks at you and says, "You're not a--" "But you--" Orus says, "Camilla, this is one of the masters of The Archanade."

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: In the silk and leather.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She says, "(gasps) Is this one of the most cultured taverns in the city? I thought The Rookery was a little bit of a hodgepodge." Orus shakes his head side to side and says, "The Rookery is home to some of the city's finest eateries and establishments. It's just a hike to get up here." He nods and says, "The locals like it that way. Less thoroughfare, less people on their way somewhere else, if you know what I mean."

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Makes it worth the journey.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Mm-hmm. I am so sorry. I'll let you both get back to this. We will discuss this.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: You know, as much as I love telling stories, I love hearing stories. Where are you going tonight?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She says, "Well, lovely to meet you, master..."

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Oh, Bolaire. Hello, yes, pleasure.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She says, "You really do know everybody."

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: That one is an artist through and through, believe you me.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She says, "I should think so, the work on that mask is exquisite." She says, "Well, where are we headed? I certainly don't know myself. We were to spend the night dancing at the Palazzo Davinos."

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: What happened?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Wouldn't you want to know, and don't we all? We arrived thinking that there would be a chance to dance and enjoy the hospitality, some fine Telmoran wines, and instead we found ourselves walking through fireflies hanging in the air, some sort of ethereal music on the breeze. The parlor tricks of a house steeped in sorcery."
segments.summary: Camilla describes strange magical phenomena at the Palazzo Davinos

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Sure, sign me up.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Found the banquet tables laid out and a massive banner flying high above some tapestries saying, 'Our final feast hosted in the city of Dol-Makjar. May all have safe passage to the realms beyond. We await our brothers and sisters in Faerie.'"
segments.summary: Camilla reveals that the Davinos family is departing for the Feywild

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: (chuckles)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "They've done it! But what I want to know is this. Why say you're having-- I mean, either do it or wait for us all to get there and do it in front of us so we can at least see it. Do it at the end of the party. Capstone, a reward for those that have been burning their heels--"
segments.summary: Camilla complains about the timing of the Davinos family's departure

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: She's got a good point.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "-- in these ridiculous shoes. Help me understand."

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Were you alone? How many people showed up at this?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Well--" Orus looks and says, "We arrived fashionably late and there were some 80 people already there. By the time we left there were some 200, 300. But many were leaving as fast as they got-- The food was a fine spread, but there were no servants, no anyone dancing and--"
segments.summary: Orus describes the scene at the Palazzo Davinos party

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Scandalous.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I think so." Go ahead and give me an insight check yourself, Hal.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: That is really low.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Ha.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: That is an eight.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On an eight insight, you see Orus just shaking his head, seeming sort of put upon. Are Murray and Azune close by as this is happening or no?

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: No.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: No, I was going to be maybe at the top of the stairs listening in, but I don't want to be seen.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I will have at some point tugged you to have a conversation with you away from this.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I definitely walked by a little bit, I'm still trying to listen, but--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Either of you give me a perception or an arcana, your choice.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Okay, okay.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You have exhaustion.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I do still have exhaustion, so this is at disadvantage.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Would I be able to do this, too, if I haven't gone all the way upstairs?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah, you can give me arcana or perception.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: She did just drink an Irish whiskey, though.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah. There you go.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: (laughs) I don't think it helps.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Natural 20.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Where was this earlier?

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Keep 'em coming, keep 'em coming.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Look, you have done so much, do you need to take a break up here? There's clearly work that can be done down there. Looks like the party's here.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Oh, I feel like there's so much more we have to talk about.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I'm heading down. Well, while this is happening, I'm getting into this conversation.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Okay, I have to tell you something. One of the things on my list that I was going to keep to myself is that I think that Einfasen is onto me. He knows my history with the Falconer's Rebellion, and I think that he, in not so many words, has made it very clear that my loyalty might be tested. I need you to remember this name: Varen Kadorn.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Varen what?

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Kadorn.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Kadorn?

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Yes, K-A-D-O-R-N.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: He is a guard for one of the Sundered Houses, and he is a former Falconer's Rebellion fighter. He goes to the Falconer's Rest on a weekly basis. I see him there. He is very trustworthy. He is who I would approach to try to get some of the Revolutionary Guards that he trusts together to be our inside people. I want you to know his name in case I don't come back tomorrow.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: You're going to come back tomorrow.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: We don't know that.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: What do you have planned? Are you going to go do something stupid?

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Probably.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: You shook your head no and then said, "Probably."

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Just to confuse you, I hope it worked.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: It's easy to confuse me right now.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: If there's a party to go to, shall we join them? I start to head down--

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Listen to me.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I was going to say--

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Listen. I grab his hand. I grab his hand.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: We're probably heading back, depending on, unless you--

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I want to finish up--

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Listen to me.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: -- with Orus, but I don't want to interrupt here.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: You and I are in the same boat, okay?

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: I know.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Dean Kora is also very much onto me. I think one of the first things that I'm going to have to do as part of this grand plan that we're all planning is I'm going to have to go and (pained swallow) apologize. It's the worst, it's the worst thing. I hate it.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: So. I'm going to go, I'm going to kiss her ass. We're going to have to be-- We're going to have to lay low on the inside. It's the only way any of this works--

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: I know.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: -- is if we pretend to be one of them.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Yes, I know. That's going to be really hard for you.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I know!

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: But you can do it. Murray, one of the best things about you is that you're so you, but they don't deserve to see that part of you. Don't show them the buttons that they can press.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: You're right. You know I have more experience eating ass than kissing it.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Okay! (snickering)

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Wow.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As Hal finishes up the song and you guys are preparing to return to your companions--

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I'm doing a little thing once you're done, because I want to plant like one or two more. I want to plant a big seed when you--

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)

In a corner, you see a chest filled with what first looked like soiled rags, but you realize are actually uncleaned finery of lords and people who dwell here in the castle. After all, they don't make statues of former rebel soldiers. They make statues of lords and ladies. Dress them up, bind them to the table, turn them to stone, throw them on the cart.

You look down and see here in this place the unmistakable visage of your brother. A little leaner, maybe. Been running on his own through the woods for about a week before they caught him. segments.content: "Without his knowledge and perhaps he did not know that there was a basilisk in his dungeon turning knights to stone. Without evidence, who could say? And yet-- I'm sorry, this is none of your concern. You're travelers in this land. Your brother has been harmed. Did you find him?"

segments.content: "What I mean to say is you have done a heroic thing rescuing these warriors." Hawkins looks down and says, "I recognize some of these statues as Knights of Vallow, a region further to the south of here. I don't know their names, but I can tell by their crest." He says, "Brave and true in the orders they belong to. This is a terrible thing we have witnessed."

segments.content: You look at Morgaine. She nods and says, "You've done the right thing by bringing these to safety. I cannot imagine what it would be if we had lost Groveland or you, your brother. But if we were to go to the middle of Candle Feast and say, 'Look what we have discovered,' what we would have is a cart full of statues. And if we were to accuse anyone of anything, what would they say? 'How terrible. We had no idea.' It's quite possible that you need to still evade while you can. Are there any alive that saw you?"

segments.content: From those names, too, all of those names that you found in there, Thimble, were people in the employ of the Tachonis. were people in the employ of the Tachonis. Meaning, and I say this in full transparency, Meaning, and I say this in full transparency, there is no wrong choice here. Everything you do will come with a price. Everything you do will lead us from one unto another. There is no wrong choice here. But to be clear about what you seek if you go to Houndsport, you do not have the names of friends. You have the names of enemies. You have the names of people in the employ of the Tachonis, people that they speak of with trust and understanding that they will get things done.

segments.content: Making your way out of the city in the carriage is pretty easy, and again, you guys have vanished. Everybody who knew you is either back in Sloak, or has essentially absconded to, or like all the Tachonis or has essentially absconded to, or like all the Tachonis that you walked into the castle invisibly. Everyone that could make you is dead on the ground in that-- In that room. Now, does being dead put someone out of reach of the Tachonis? Maybe not, but you have time Maybe not, but you have time and no one saw you come in this wagon or take a little farm road out of Tbyry's Lea.

segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you begin to leave to get to somewhere safer to rest, I think, Wick, you look out and see this beautiful Candle Feast festival happening all around you. The people at the Candescent Creed celebrating what seems like a really joyful night. People seem moved and impassioned and alive and happy People seem moved and impassioned and alive and happy that the lord has converted here in this way. There is an electric feeling in the air of passion and meaning and togetherness and community. of passion and meaning and togetherness and community. You see the Lux moving throughout that town square and I think you just see that begin to fade as the carriage pulls away.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Making your way somewhat outside of the city, you find a copse of trees that you can pull aside from. This is all completely open farmland. There's hounds and knights and things around, you can find a little place to pull aside and begin to rest, if you so desire, and the night envelops you, soft and cool. and the night envelops you, soft and cool. Your quest is a success. You have done as you set out on this road to do. It is simply that you have discovered how much vaster and broader the problems of the world are, all of which is to say, this story will conclude in this chapter where you all say it does. I don't want to rush you towards an ending, but I want to put out there that any scenes that you want, any things that need saying, any decisions that need making, we are very much in that world now.

Spend the first real time with Cyd, looking at the statue, looking over the details of it, examining his face, his neck, his arms, any detail of the statue that might stand out to him. And in the pose that he sees, he notices an open hand, and Teor will take out the small wooden lion's head and place it in his brother's hand and clasp his own over it.
segments.summary: Teor examines Cyd's statue and places the wooden lion's head in his brother's open hand

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: And like he and Cyd and their father did so many nights, he will say, "The stars remember, "before the gods rose and fell, "before the wars began, "our ancestors roared beneath the same stars you see now. "They still watch, "still listen. "And when you doubt yourself, "look up, "their strength still runs in your veins."
segments.summary: Teor recites a family ritual about the stars and ancestors

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you walk away from the carriage, you look up at the stars, your brother's body weighs 2,000 pounds and he's never looked lighter. You didn't get to see him in Dol-Makjar, but whatever life was like there was not treating him well. He looks hungry, tired. You have that wooden lion's head back and you think about the fact of what it took all of you to lift and drag this stone statue onto this.
segments.summary: Brennan describes Teor's feelings about his brother's statue and condition

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: out. Sitting here in the fire, crackling, you think of the fires of the realm which birthed you, gaze at this knife and begin to get lost in it. As you attune to it, you look into the blade. You are a demon that has only worn this form for a time, but the stuff with which you are made is older than time itself. Deep in a writhing pit of entropy and destruction, the substance that made you was waiting for this world to be born so you could come and ruin it. You look at this knife, you are so drawn to it. You were shaped by the hand of the Shadow of Suffering, ancient demon whose voice you've heard this very night, and there's something in this knife, you are drawn to it and it has to do with pain, you're certain of it. That's what you're here to do. Contract with a mortal family of sorcerers be damned, you are here to hurt the world. You look in that knife and you start to attune to it and you see a mother's hand, some pumpkins and squash from a little mountainside garden, roasted and seasoned and covered in honey, fresh seeds, and you can hear the babbling of a nearby baby. This thing roasted to a point of softness, and you can see her cutting through with a knife, each cut going into something, making it a small each cut going into something, making it a small and perfect size to go into a little child's hand. Every little motion of the knife is a prayer, hoping that a thing she loves more than life itself will take a little morsel of food and get a little stronger, a little bigger, a little more ready for a world she can't predict. This knife has been an instrument of love for more times than you can count and you get lost in that memory. Where does Tyranny go in this memory, and what crosses her mind as she looks?
segments.summary: Brennan describes Tyranny's experience attuning to the knife, revealing her demonic origins and the knife's history as an instrument of love and care.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: This is the first gift that Tyranny has ever received in earnest, and it was born of understanding of shortcomings and flaws. As she looks down at the knife, all she feels is searing jealousy of humanity.
segments.summary: Tyranny reflects on receiving her first genuine gift and feels jealous of humanity.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You're a demon born of pain, so perhaps it's fitting that you can't stop looking at this knife that's hurting you. There is a secret. Something in here is eluding you, it's taunting you. The lessons of the Creed might be a lie, but there's something true in this knife. For all of the ancientness of the energy suffusing your being, it is beyond your grasp. You attune to this knife, but its final form eludes you, for indeed, in another world, another time, an object like this might have been referred to as a Vestige of Divergence, But here, you're just a demon holding a kitchen knife that you stole from a little old gnome.
segments.summary: Brennan reveals the knife is potentially a Vestige of Divergence, though its true power eludes Tyranny for now.

segments.content: (startled noise)
segments.summary: Sam reacts to the Vestige of Divergence reveal.

segments.content: God, I wish I knew what that was. It sounds so sick.
segments.summary: Whitney expresses interest in the Vestige of Divergence concept.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Something in this knife can grow, along with your understanding of this world, but it's a world you don't understand yet, and so your feet for which I mean your hooves, get warmed by the fire as you gaze into a knife, you have much to learn. The knife's magic rests at your fingertips. There's something here, but you won't find it tonight.
segments.summary: Brennan explains that the knife's power will grow with Tyranny's understanding of the world.

It's bad, he can't hit shit, just like tonight, and he's feeling inadequate and angry and he's throwing the darts harder, and the harder that he throws, the worse he gets, and this frustration builds and grows until he's just out of darts and he's got one left in his hand and he can't do it. Slams his club down, slams the dart down, and he's frustrated by his inadequacy, and also feeling connected to these people and also feeling connected to these people for the first time in a long time, and I think that connection is making him question himself. There's no comfort here. He's lost in his own skin, so he has to move his body, and he starts to move his body again, and he catches himself doing everything he can to warm up and and feel inside of himself and he's doing pushups, he's jumping, he's moving his body, and as he moves, he starts to forget about the people that he's with and he's alone, with himself, and tapping into his own body and this is when I will choose to level up.

segments.content: Hey. You know we can do better. It's been you and I for a long time. You're a good boy, but you know we can do better. All the fights, all the pain, all the years. Come on. Fucking do it. Just do it. The quiver on his hip starts to glow, this found relic from a battle a long time ago, one of our first. The runes on it start to glow. And in that moment, the faint outline of the red bolt that would never manifest and never come into being (searing sizzle) sizzles to life and his quiver has an extra arrow in it, an extra bolt for the first time. You can tell that energy from the one that we lost in the cave, that thing that was meant to be a moment for us to excel together that we failed at, that energy is dissipated and now there are two arrows that energy is dissipated and now there are two arrows in Wulferic's quiver. For the first time, Kattigan just really feels, For the first time, Kattigan just really feels, and what he feels is pride, and maybe just a little bit of hope. He walks back to the fire and he pets his fucking dog.
